title: Famous First Ladies
description: While the president is the most important person in the United States, another important person stands by his side--the First Lady. Famous First Ladies is about three women who not only supported their husbands, but also worked to improve education and to help people in need. Eleanor Roosevelt, Jacqueline Kennedy, and Hillary Rodham Clinton will forever be remembered as First Ladies that made a difference in the lives of their families, as well as the lives of people across the country.
highFrequencyWords: assassinated, discrimination, humanitarian, immunizations, influential, polio
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Nouns                : Recognize and form plural nouns
awareness: Content Vocabulary                : Recognize and use content vocabulary
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
